headline: Who's running in the Paris mayoral election?
subhead: Six main candidates are vying to succeed Mayor Anne Hidalgo, who is not running for re-election, in the municipal elections on March 15 and 22.

headline: US Senate passes deal expected to shorten shutdown
US approves multibillion-dollar arms sales to both Israel and Saudi Arabia
Social media ban for under-15s: Why everyone in France will soon have to verify their age
subhead: If the bill is adopted on schedule, all social media users in France will have to undergo age verification before the end of the year.

headline: Zaki Laïdi, political scientist: 'In 2025, building spheres of influence is infinitely more difficult than during the Cold War'
subhead: While the theory of spheres of influence is highly popular, four factors counterbalance it, writes the international systems expert in an op-ed for Le Monde. Laïdi describes a hybrid world order, where Sino-American bipolarization and the rise of the Global South collide.

headline: In Svalbard, where sea ice is vanishing faster than anywhere else, polar bears remain healthy
subhead: The bears have not lost weight over the past 20 years in the Norwegian archipelago, despite the region's accelerating warming. Among the reasons: They hunt prey other than seals, such as reindeer and birds.

headline: Thomas Piketty: 'European countries have achieved unprecedented levels of prosperity and social well-being'
subhead: To win the cultural and intellectual battle, Europe must staunchly defend its model, writes the economist in his column, dismantling the narrative of a 'declining' continent.

headline: Venezuela's interim president announces mass amnesty law
In Switzerland, an ill-prepared army faces the new global disorder
Actor Catherine O'Hara, known for her roles in 'Schitt's Creek' and 'Home Alone,' has died at age 71
US Justice Department releases over 3 million more pages of Epstein files
Chadian president Mahamat Idriss Déby returns to Paris
Thousands rally in Minneapolis' freezing temperatures as anti-ICE anger continues to escalate
Pieter Mulier leaves Maison Alaïa
Beehives, yachts and cattle: How France manages 'atypical' seized assets
Nestlé knew of toxins in baby formula 10 days before first recalls
UN faces 'imminent financial collapse,' Guterres says
Yuri Dmitriev, the Russian historian imprisoned for denouncing Kremlin attempts to rewrite history
Paris reaches the pinnacle of haute couture
'Facing Trump, Europe, Canada and Latin America have to navigate between misalignment, non-alignment and avoidance'
subhead: The sweeping powers that the US president has granted himself through his Board of Peace serve only to discourage even the best intentions, observes Le Monde's columnist Gilles Paris.

headline: 'For sure': Two impromptu words by Macron go viral
subhead: During his speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos, the French president delivered a common English phrase – in a strong accent – that achieved global fame.

headline: Denmark's long and difficult reckoning with America's abandonment
subhead: Since the end of the Cold War, the Scandinavian kingdom pursued a 'super-Atlanticist' strategy in hopes that the US would come to its aid when needed. Now, trust between Washington and Copenhagen has been broken.

headline: The duty of solidarity with the Iranian people
John Bolton: 'Toppling the Iranian regime is the most effective way to remove the terrorist threat the West has faced'
France's under-15 social media ban: 'Parents are being asked to do the dirty work that the government has refused to impose'
